's Council on Jobs and Competitiveness. Having worked with Jeff Immelt in the past, Steve Ballmer apparently wanted the world to know where he stands. He released the following statement on the Official Microsoft blog: Jeff Immelt and I started our careers together at Proctor& Gamble, and I have enormous respect for the success he's had at GE. He is an ideal business leader to chair the Barack Obama 's Council on Jobs and Competitiveness and help drive a focus on what we can all do to increase American competitiveness and create new jobs. Microsoft is all about some competitiveness lately, as evidenced by the company recently joining Fairsearch, the coalition ruffling Google's feathers over its pending acquisition of ITA Software.
